gobblin.runtime

Interface JobLauncher

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractJobLauncher, CliLocalJobLauncher, CliMRJobLauncher, LocalJobLauncher, MRJobLauncher

    public interface JobLauncher
extends Closeable
    An interface for classes that launch a Gobblin job.

    A JobLauncher is not supposed to be reused, i.e., each JobLauncher should only be used to launch a single job.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cancelJob(JobListener jobListener)
      Cancel a Gobblin job.
      void launchJob(JobListener jobListener)
      Launch a Gobblin job.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.io.Closeable

        close

    • Method Detail

      • launchJob

        void launchJob(@Nullable
               JobListener jobListener)
        throws JobException
        Launch a Gobblin job.

        This method is synchronous, i.e., the caller will be blocked until the job finishes. The method JobListener.onJobCompletion(JobContext) of the given JobListener will be called at the end if no uncaught exceptions are thrown before the method gets called.

        Parameters:
        jobListener - a JobListener instance on which JobListener.onJobCompletion(JobContext) is called at the end of this method if it is not null
        Throws:
        JobException - if there is anything wrong launching and running the job

      • cancelJob

        void cancelJob(@Nullable
               JobListener jobListener)
        throws JobException
        Cancel a Gobblin job.

        This method is synchronous, i.e., the caller will be blocked until the cancellation is executed. The method JobListener.onJobCancellation(JobContext) of the given JobListener will be called at the end if the caller is not interrupted while being blocked. If a cancellation has already been requested, however, this method will return immediately.

        Parameters:
        jobListener - JobListener instance on which JobListener.onJobCancellation(JobContext) is called at the end of this method if it is not null
        Throws:
        JobException - if there is anything wrong cancelling the job
